conclusion: Identify relevant information from the image and question to calculate Ampere force.
Image depicts a wire forming triangle ABC with uniform magnetic fields perpendicular to the plane, lengths AB and BC labeled as L, and angle ∠ABC is 120°.
Wire ABC is perpendicular to the magnetic field and experiences an Ampere force due to currents in wires AB and BC.
Calculate Ampere force using formula F = I × B × L.
With angle ∠ABC as 120°, force components along AB and BC are equal, total force F = 2 × I × B × L × sin(60°).
Simplify sin(60°) = √3/2, so F = √3 × I × B × L.
Substitute I = 1, B = 1, and L = 1, then F = √3.
